Content-Type: text/plain;

Was it wise to allow this stranger inside?  Was the thought that now races =
through Tucson's mind.   He gives his newborn back to Talon for safe keepin=
g and then stands up to face the Deciple.  He growls, just as the old drago=
n would do when he wanted strangers out of his cave.  Two smacks of his tai=
l on the ground tells all.  He was not fooling around, and now with offspri=
ng, he knew he had to keep an even stronger vigil.

" On second thought, I =
don't think I like your demeanor!  This is MY domain and MY family!  And if=
 you are wise you will not approach me any further!    Do so and I will not=
 hesitate to do whatever it takes to cast you out of the rookery!"

His eye=
s narrow as he gives a battle ready snarl.  The females who had helped Talo=
n also take his side as they too take a stand for the sake of Talon and the=
 babies.  The elder female also joins this fight as she nods to Tucson.  It=
's at this time when Tucson lets out a booming roar to assert his place as =
the Sire of the rookery.  

Bolts of lightning like energy leaves his mouth=
 as he gives his warning roar .

Local artist who specializes in illustrati=
on, using traditional and digital media.  

I also specialize in hand made =
crafts.  Great for any occasion!  

Need a great gift idea that is original=
?  No problem!  Email me at this address and we will talk.  

On Jun 29, 20=
12, at 12:19 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>=

> >
> > Tucson looks to the dragon, not knowing him, and looking to his st=
range
> > black coloration along with his silver as well. He was stiff with=

> > apprehension, yet, knew not to rouse this dragon.
> >
> > "How did you=
 know who I am? And who are you? I find that rather strange
> > that you kn=
ow me, seeing that the old dragon had no mention of another, yet
> > alone =
another who can converse in my language."
> >
> > He gets up, and stands ra=
ther stiffly. He's swift to shift his weight
> > around, and put himself in=
 front of the mouth of the cave.
> >
> > " I'm sorry, but my child is about=
 to be born and I wish no harm to come to
> > it."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> The silv=
er and Black Dragon whom the others are calling DISCIPLE,
> tilted his head=
 quizzically as he looked at TUCSON and then nodded,
> humor glinting in hi=
s eye. "I do not come for your progeny." he said
> as he straightened. "The=
re is one who would speak with you."
> 
> As DISCIPLE spoke the other drago=
ns were still bowing or at least
> looking down deferentially. A few whispe=
red the name ARCANE in hushed
> tones.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-5B63EBAE-1854-4FA8-BA7C-9CF4F7592142

The silver =
and Black Dragon whom the others are calling DISCIPLE,<br>
tilted his head =
quizzically as he looked at TUCSON and then nodded,<br>
humor glinting in h=
is eye. "I do not come for your progeny." he said<br>
as he straightened. "=
There is one who would speak with you."<br>

r dragons were still bowing or at least<br>
